availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Harrison County Court } Special Term August 21st 1861

The written Resignation of William Crosswhite Esq a Justice of the Peace in Precinct No 6 in this County, was this day produced in open Court, which was accepted by the Court and Ordered to be filed, and, , John S. Scott Esq recommended as a Suitable person to fill Said Vacancy,

A. Copy Attest
P. Wherritt Clk

To His Excellency
B. Magiffin Governor of Kentucky
Dear Sir

I. Sint the Certificate of the Election of Isaac Ramey Esq Justice of the peace in Precinct No 5. in this County to fill the unexpired Term of Charles Lail Esq Decd, to the Secretary of State, a few days after the August Election, he ^Ramey.^ informed me by letter from Colemansville (his Post office) that his Commission had not been received, which is the Cause of this note,

Harrison Co
J. P.
Dist No 5 & 6
Comd Aug 30 1861
